WorkItem.Description:
A stack trace indicates that this is the autofilter defined name failing to recognise a reference containing a worksheet name.
The PHPExcel_Cell::absoluteCoordinate() method requires a simple cell ref, without a worksheet name; but is being passed a cell reference including a worksheet name, so it triggers an error.
Â 
The fix is in the _writeDefinedNameForAutofilter() method of the PHPExcel_Writer_Excel2007_Workbook class; modifying it to strip the worksheet name before calling PHPExcel_Cell::absoluteCoordinate().
I'll patch this in the latest SVN code within the next half hour or so.
WorkItem.Summary: Invalid cell coordinate in Autofilter for Excel2007 Writer

Comments.Message: It is a bug, but I can't see why yet: The stored value is 'test'!$A$4:$C$4 which should be correct

Ah! The value stored as the named range in the workbook is 'test'!$A$4:$C$4, which is correct; but the value stored in the worksheet is TEST!A4:C4, but it shouldn't have the worksheet reference. Fixed in SVN

Thank you for your good job and your reactivity.
Have a nice day.

The same correction in Writer/Excel5.php is it possible ?
Thanks.
So this is still an issue, correct? 1.7.6 seems to give this error when opening an excell2007 xslx and then resaving.
You can download Writer/Excel2007.php in the 'Source Code' tab.
